channel.title: PyBites - PyBites
channel.description: Python Code Challenges, Articles and News - One Bite a Day

item.title: Twitter digest 2017 week 28
item.description: Every weekend we share a curated list of 15 cool things (mostly Python) that we found / tweeted throughout the week.
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 27 - PRAW: The Python Reddit API Wrapper
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python coding! Love or hate Reddit, it has a lot of good data to work with. This week we have you write an app of your choice using the Reddit API. Have fun!
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: 200 Days of PyBites, 100 Days of Code and our Next Project
item.description: We did it! #100DaysOfCode is done: 5K lines of code, 100 scripts. Just on the day PyBites turns 200 days. In this article we will share our learning on this major project and announce our next 100 days effort ...
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 26 - Create a Simple Python GUI
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python coding! Web apps tend to get all the love so it’s about time we shared the spotlight with GUIs. This week let’s take our first dive as a PyBites Community into Python GUIs!
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 25 - Notification Service of Now Playing and Upcoming Movies - Review

item.title: Code Challenge 25 - Notification Service of Now Playing and Upcoming Movies
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python coding! What movies are in theaters now or just came out on your favorite streaming service? What are upcoming movies, when will they be released? Can I keep track of all new humor movies? Or what about that specific actor or director? Having a notification service around movies seems an interesting, fun and useful code challenge to us.
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 24 - Use Dunder / Special Methods to Enrich a Class - Review

item.title: Code Challenge 24 - Use Dunder / Special Methods to Enrich a Class
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python coding! We wrote an article for Dan Bader's Python blog: Enriching Your Python Classes With Dunder (Magic, Special) Methods. We hope you like it. To put dunders into practice we dedicate this week's code challenge to it.
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 23 - Challenge Estimated Time API - Review
item.description: In this article we review last week's Challenge Estimated Time API. This was a cool challenge and we implemented it using Github's awesome platform and API.

item.title: Code Challenge 23 - Challenge Estimated Time API
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python coding! This week we will give you the opportunity to enhance our challenge platform by creating a simple API to track how much time our challenges take (and possibly other metadata).
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 22 - Packt Free Ebook Web Scraper - Review
item.description: In this article we review last week's Packt free ebook code challenge. We really scratched our own itch building both a notification service and an ebook download manager.

item.title: Code Challenge 22 - Packt Free Ebook Web Scraper
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python coding! This week we will do some web scraping of Packt's daily free ebook, sending out daily notifications. This week we even have a unique opportunity to sponsor the Python Community, read on ... and happy coding!

item.title: Code Challenge 21 - Electricity Cost Calculation App
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python coding! This week we will get you to create a simple app to calculate the monetary cost of using an electrical device. Enjoy!
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 20 - Object Oriented Programming Fun - Review

item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python coding! This week we will let you experiment with Object Oriented Programming, an important skill and fundamental building block of (everthing-is-an-object) Python. Enjoy!

item.title: Code Challenge 19 - Post to Your Favorite API - Review

item.title: Behind the Scenes of PyBites - a Blog for Passionate Pythonistas (Post #100 Special)
item.description: Python is hot according to Dice. It’s an easy language to learn, has an elegant design and is widely used. In this article we proudly present our now 4 months journey into building PyBites. It’s a reflection of what we achieved and lessons learned. We hope to inspire fellow developers to start their own venture. It is very rewarding!
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 15 - Create a Simple Flask App
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python coding! This week we’re going to get down and dirty with Python Flask. Flask is becoming a hot skill to have up your sleeve. We’re all in with learning it so figure it’s about time we had a challenge on it! Enjoy!
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 14 - Write DRY Code With Decorators
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python coding! This week we let you practice with decorators, a nice way to abstract away common functionality. It allows you to alter the behavior of a callable without modifying the callable itself. We agree with Dan Bader that 'understanding decorators is a milestone for any serious Python programmer.' Enjoy!
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: I have been coding in Python for years and I still ...
item.description: A quick post on a fun trend we saw on Twitter this morning: people posting how long they coded for and what they still had to lookup. Some of this is tongue in cheek of course, but the point is that programming is not easy. Secondly there is no shame in looking things up, we all do it! What do fellow Pythonistas say?
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 01 - Word Values Part I - Review
item.description: Wow! We have been amazed by the great response on github and HN. It's Friday so we review the code challenge of this week. We describe our learning and a possible solution. We will also digest comments left on the Monday post.
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 01 - Word Values Part I
item.description: Our first weekly code challenge is to calculate the (language) dictionary word that would have the most value in Scrabble. Enjoy and let us know if you like this format.
